column4: Have just aquired a Netbook, and need to reformat and install tonight however the previous owner has asked for old data to be saved. how do I do this when I get halfway booting before messages come up with fsck failed and stays in consol
Oxidize so what if it is?
hacking is a word open to interpretation
please do not feed the troll
do you have net ocnection on console ?
ask
you can access the files you need to rescue ? and you can execute apt and other utilities ?
I dont know how to, would you mind helping me to the files and to copying them or to get the desktop back
yu do not have experience in console ?
sorry; can you « cd /home/ » ?
e2fsck -pkc /dev/sdxx
where /dev/sdxx is the apropiat block device of the failing partition
please use my correct nick...
sorry wrong name! I'll try that ta
is this a flash based netbook ? or it has a normal HD ?
normal platter based drive
then do « sudo fdisk -l » to find out what device to check
MAny thanks - I have login and and ready to Go, on last question, if the old owner just wanted his personal data linked to the one log-in, is '/home' the only part I need to copy?
yes it should be there in his home (you can ask if he saved anything out of his home )
many thanks - ok he wouldn't have a clue! he is a noob in the politest sense, I'll just have to hope I saved everything! thank you for your help and your time. :)
no problem; good luck
permissions/ownership on vfat fs are "faked" at mount time following mount options or fstab
the same in ntfs
